title: Authors and Citation
text: Jelle Stuurman. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: AHN (2023). “Actueel Hoogtebestand Nederland (AHN).” https://www.ahn.nl. https://www.ahn.nl. PDOK (2023). “Actueel Hoogtebestand Nederland (AHN) - PDOK.” https://www.pdok.nl/introductie/-/article/actueel-hoogtebestand-nederland-ahn. https://www.pdok.nl/introductie/-/article/actueel-hoogtebestand-nederland-ahn.
code: @Article{,   title = {Actueel Hoogtebestand Nederland (AHN)},   author = {{AHN}},   journal = {https://www.ahn.nl},   url = {https://www.ahn.nl},   year = {2023}, } @Article{,   author = {{PDOK}},   journal = {https://www.pdok.nl/introductie/-/article/actueel-hoogtebestand-nederland-ahn},   title = {Actueel Hoogtebestand Nederland (AHN) - PDOK},   url = {https://www.pdok.nl/introductie/-/article/actueel-hoogtebestand-nederland-ahn},   year = {2023}, }

what: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: Updated: 16-04-2024 R package automatically extracts elevation points areas Netherlands Actueel Hoogtebestand Nederland (AHN) datasets collected AHN. Individual elevations, elevation raster areas can extracted AHN4 using geo atom web services made available PDOK. PDOK makes recent AHN available. Currently version AHN4. next release also support older versions AHN made available elsewhere. *support 5 m. resolution AHN4 follow. Please refer quality documentation provided (Dutch ) details data. AHN organisation collects AHN data. ## 1. Installation download therAHNextract package GitHub, library devtools required. want compile code source code, program Rtools needed. Rtools required make use rAHNextract package. plot rasters using plot() terra package required.

title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: Retrieving individual AHN elevation points elevation raster areas can retrieved two methods: WCS method sheets method. WCS method fastest method makes use OGC WCS protocol. output GeoTIFF file. method efficient AHN elevations areas need retrieved. sheets method, data retrieved 1km x 6.25 km raster sheets (kaartbladen) made made available PDOK. method slower needs download sheets required retrieve AHN (200-500 mb per sheet). method recommended used many (point) elevations need retrieved certain small area. points raster areas, WCS method set default. sheets method can used setting sheets.method = TRUE.

title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: Extraction elevation done based raster data receives sources. Determining elevation can tricky correct resampling applied. script always ensures correct resampling takes place adjusting raster cells need downloaded whenever necessary. called ‘rectified grid.’ avoid issues, interpolation rectified grid raster determine elevation always done script OGC method online. Please refer important always use rectified grids. Please refer read different extraction methods allowed: ‘simple’ (nearest) ‘bilinear’. package default extraction.method parameter set ‘simple’.

title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: examples show possibilities package combining different parameters. different examples show different geometries (circle, bbox, custom polygon) can retrieved raster areas. Please use complete documentation functions R see available parameters. desired, points areas using WGS84 coordinate system (Longitude Latitude coordinates) can used input setting LONLAT = TRUE. efficiency accuracy purposes, returned raster areas always done using RD New coordinate system (source). ahn_point() ahn_area() default output temporary file. Set location directory want keep raster output (point) using output.dir parameter.

title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: ahn_point() function returns AHN elevation provided point.

title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: examples gets elevation AHN (default) using DSM (default) DEM. Changing DEM type can adjusted dem parameter(“DTM”, “DSM”)
code: ahn_point(X = 136544, Y = 456070) #> [1] "https://service.pdok.nl/rws/ahn/wcs/v1_0/?&SERVICE=WCS&VERSION=1.0.0&REQUEST=GetCoverage" #> [1] "Download raster image succeeded." #> [1] "Intersecting raster. Getting elevation..." #> [1] "Elevation of AHNelevation: 63.57 m." #> [1] 63.57

title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: sheets method can used setting sheets.method = TRUE. AHN sheets always stored default {current working directory}/AHN_output/AHN_sheets can adjusted using sheets.dir parameter. sheets always stored ‘AHN_sheets’ folder used AHN DEM. examples gets elevation AHN DSM exact point. Please see parameters available ahn_point()
code: ahn_point(name = "Utrecht point", X = 136550, Y = 456060, AHN = "AHN", dem = "DTM", sheets.method = TRUE) #> [1] "The AHN sheets are loaded from or downloaded in: C:/Users/jelle/stack/GitHub/rAHNextract/rAHNextract_dev/AHN_sheets. If no AHN sheet in the correct directory or if no correct name of AHN sheet is found, sheet will be downloaded. For first use it is recommended to use the default output directory." #> [1] "Destination directory of output AHN sheet M_31HZ2.tif: C:/Users/jelle/stack/GitHub/rAHNextract/rAHNextract_dev/AHN_sheets/AHN4/DTM" #> [1] "Intersecting raster. Getting elevation..." #> [1] "Elevation of Utrecht point: 4.60 m." #> [1] 4.6

title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: ahn_area()returns AHN elevation raster provided area.

previous_headings: 4. Examples > 4.2 AHN elevation areas > 4.2.1 WCS method
title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: example gets circular area AHN DSM, saving output raster custom output directory.
code: Utrecht_circleWCS <- ahn_area(name = "Utrecht circle", X = 136544, Y = 456070, resolution = 0.5, radius = 130, output.dir = "C:/myProject") #> [1] "Creating circle from single X,Y point and a radius input." #> [1] "Destination directory of output AHN area: C:/myProject" #> [1] "Download raster image succeeded."  plot(Utrecht_circleWCS, xlab = "RD X", ylab = "RD Y", main = "AHN Elevation (m)")

what: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: example gets BBOX (using point radius) AHN DSM.
code: Utrecht_WCSsBBOX <- ahn_area(name = "Utrecht rBBOX", X = 136550, Y = 456060, radius = 130, bbox = TRUE, resolution = 0.5) #> [1] "Creating bbox from X,Y point and radius input." #> [1] "Download raster image succeeded." plot(Utrecht_WCSsBBOX, xlab = "RD X", ylab = "RD Y", main = "AHN Elevation (m)")

what: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: example makes bbox using BBOX coordinates AHN DTM.
code: Utrecht_WCSBBOX <- ahn_area(name = "Utrecht BBOX", bbox = c(136440, 455940, 136650, 456160), dem = "DTM", resolution = 0.5) #> [1] "Creating BBOX from BBOX coordinates." #> [1] "Download raster image succeeded." plot(Utrecht_WCSBBOX, xlab = "RD X", ylab = "RD Y", main = "AHN Elevation (m)")

previous_headings: 4. Examples > 4.2 AHN elevation areas > 4.2.1 WCS method
title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: example retrieves AHN area custom shape area 5m resolution DSM AHN3.
code: library(sf) Utrecht.gpkg <- sf::st_read(paste0("C:/myProject/rAHNextract_tests.gpkg"), layer = "my_polygon") #> Reading layer `my_polygon' from data source `C:\myProject\rAHNextract_tests.gpkg' using driver `GPKG' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 0 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 136424.8 ymin: 455938.7 xmax: 136664.1 ymax: 456121.9 #> Projected CRS: Amersfoort / RD New  Utrecht_WCSpolygon <- ahn_area(name = "Utrecht polygon", polygon = Utrecht.gpkg, resolution = 0.5) #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 0 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 136424.8 ymin: 455938.7 xmax: 136664.1 ymax: 456121.9 #> Projected CRS: Amersfoort / RD New #>                             geom #> 1 POLYGON ((136486.7 455945.3... #> [1] "Creating area from custom geometry." #> [1] "Download raster image succeeded." plot(Utrecht_WCSpolygon, xlab = "RD X", ylab = "RD Y", main = "AHN Elevation (m)")

title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: sheets method can used setting sheets.method = TRUE. example gets elevation raster form circle. bigger BBOX intersects 2 sheets automatically downloaded processed merged one raster output. AHN sheets saved (loaded) ‘AHN_sheets’ directory set directory. intersection made 3 ir 4 sheets, wil downloaded well,. Please note downloading 4 AHN sheets around 1GB storage space.
code: Utrecht_sheets <- ahn_area(name = "Utrecht circle", X = 136550, Y = 456060, radius = 500, AHN = "AHN", sheets.method = TRUE, output.dir = "C:/myProject") #> [1] "Creating circle from single X,Y point and a radius input." #> [1] "The AHN sheets are loaded from or downloaded into: C:/myProject/AHN_sheets. If no AHN sheet(s) are found in this directory or if no correct name of AHN sheet(s) are found, the AHN sheet(s) will be downloaded." #> [1] "https://service.pdok.nl/rws/ahn/atom/downloads/dsm_05m/R_31HZ2.tif" #> [1] "Destination directory of output AHN sheet R_31HZ2.tif: C:/myProject/AHN_sheets/AHN4/DSM" #> [1] "https://service.pdok.nl/rws/ahn/atom/downloads/dsm_05m/R_31HN2.tif" #> [1] "Destination directory of output AHN sheet R_31HN2.tif: C:/myProject/AHN_sheets/AHN4/DSM" #> [1] "Masked raster and saved on disk at: C:/myProject/Utrecht_circle_AHN4_dsm05m.tif" plot(Utrecht_sheets, xlab = "RD X", ylab = "RD Y", main = "AHN Elevation (m)")

title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: also possible download AHN sheets. done providing list() kaartbladen nrs sheets parameter. setting thzsheets AHN, dem sheets.dir become relevant. AHN sheets always stored default {current working directory}/AHN_output/AHN_sheets can adjusted using sheets.dirt parameter. sheets always stored ‘AHN_sheets’ folder followed AHN DEM folders. Please see parameters available ahn_area()
code: ahn_area(AHN = "AHN", dem = "DTM", sheets = list("31HN1", "31HN2"), sheets.dir = "C:/myProject") #> [1] "The AHN sheets are loaded from or downloaded into: C:/myProject/AHN_sheets. If no AHN sheet(s) are found in this directory or if no correct name of AHN sheet(s) are found, the AHN sheet(s) will be downloaded." #> [1] "Destination directory of output AHN sheet M_31HN1.tif: C:/myProject/AHN_sheets/AHN4/DTM" #> [1] "Destination directory of output AHN sheet M_31HN2.tif: C:/myProject/AHN_sheets/AHN4/DTM" #> [1] "C:/myProject/AHN_sheets/AHN4/DTM/M_31HN1.tif" "C:/myProject/AHN_sheets/AHN4/DTM/M_31HN2.tif"

title: Extract elevation points or areas in the Netherlands from the AHN
text: Support downloading point clouds longer available release. Support may come back future release.

title: AHN raster area — ahn_area
text: Get AHN raster area specified area. AHN Area retrieved circle (x, y radius), BBOX (x, y radius, BBOX coordinates), geometry (polygon). AHN data obtained AHN3 (default), AHN2 AHN 1 available resolutions. Available Digital Surface Model (DSM) Digital Terrain Model (DTM). can download AHN data using WCS method (default, sheets.method = FALSE) returning GeoTIFF format. sheets method (sheets.method = TRUE) returns regular raster GeoTIFF output file extracted PDOK sheets. WCS method recommended AHN elevation points need extracted. sheets method always requires data downloaded client may efficient many elevations need retrieved small area. Choosing method depends speed desired output format. See documentation available parameters.

title: AHN raster area — ahn_area
code: ahn_area(   name = "AHNarea",   output.dir,   X,   Y,   radius,   bbox,   polygon,   AHN = "AHN",   dem,   resolution,   sheets = list(),   LONLAT = FALSE,   sheets.method = FALSE,   sheets.dir,   sheets.keep = TRUE )

title: AHN raster area — ahn_area
text: name Optional. Give name specified area. name used output file names. output.dir Optional unnecessary. Set location output raster files. Leaving blank (default) make output point files temporary files. output directory excludes location AHN sheets depicted sheets.dir parameter. X Required. X coordinate RD New WGS84 (LON). Y Required. Y coordinate RD New WGS84 (LAT). radius Required circle BBOX BBOX coordinates provided. Set radius meters area around point create buffer area (circle). bbox Required using BBOX. Create BBOX area. Use c(XMIN, YMIN, XMAX, YMAX) set TRUE radius provided. Use RD New WGS84 (LONLAT) coordinates. polygon Required create area custom geometry. Use spatial object area. Refer sf formats supported polygons. AHN Default 'AHN'. 'AHN' latest full version made available PDOK OGC Web services. Choose 'AHN4', 'AHN3', 'AHN2', 'AHN1'. dem Default 'DSM'. Choose type Digital Elevation Model. 'DSM' 'DTM'. AHN1 'DTM'. resolution Default 0.5 meters AHN2/AHN3/AHN4, 5 meters AHN1. Choose resolution AHN meters. AHN3 AHN2 0.5 5 meters. AHN1 5 100 m. sheets required full AHN sheets need downloaded. , fill list() object strings sheet numbers. LONLAT Optional. Default FALSE. Set TRUE X Y Longitude Latitude format. Output RD New format. sheets.method Default FALSE. TRUE, downloads AHN area available GeoTIFF AHN sheets available PDOK. sheets.dir Default 'AHN_sheets' directory working directory output.dir (defined). sheets directory AHN sheets downloaded. sheets already exists directory, reused redownload take place. Within sheets directory, directory structure created automatically: sheets.dir set 'myFolder', sheets downloaded appropriate AHN version DEM folder. Eg. 'output.dir/myFolder/AHN_sheets/AHN4/DSM'. want use parameter want central location AHN sheets stored can accessed elsewhere purposes. recommended always use original file name download. Due size GeoTiff sheets, allowed download RAM memory (tempdir). sheets.keep Default TRUE. applicable sheets.method set TRUE sheets downloaded. Set FALSE want delete downloaded sheet. recommended keep sheets ahn elevation extraction followed.

title: AHN raster area — ahn_area
text: GeoTIFF file AHN area

title: AHN raster area — ahn_area
text: Jelle Stuurman

title: AHN elevation point — ahn_point
text: Get elevation specific point location. Requires X Y coordinates input. AHN data obtained AHN available resolutions. Default resolution always highest resolution (smallest number). Available Digital Surface Model (DSM) Digital Terrain Model (DTM). can download AHN data using WCS method (default, sheets.method = FALSE) returning GeoTIFF format. sheets method (sheets.method = TRUE) returns regular raster GeoTIFF output file extracted PDOK sheets. WCS method recommended AHN elevation points need extracted. sheets method always requires data downloaded client may efficient many elevations need retrieved small area. Choosing method depends speed desired output format. See documentation available parameters.

title: AHN elevation point — ahn_point
code: ahn_point(   name = "AHNelevation",   X,   Y,   AHN = "AHN",   dem,   resolution,   output.dir,   LONLAT = FALSE,   extract.method = "simple",   decimals = 2,   sheets.method = FALSE,   sheets.dir,   sheets.keep = TRUE )

title: AHN elevation point — ahn_point
text: name Optional. Give name specified area. name used output file names. X Required. X coordinate RD New WGS84 (LON). Y Required. Y coordinate RD New WGS84 (LAT). AHN Default 'AHN'. 'AHN' latest full version made available PDOK OGC Web services. Choose 'AHN4', 'AHN3', 'AHN2', 'AHN1'. dem Default 'DSM'. Choose type Digital Elevation Model. 'DSM' 'DTM'. AHN1 'DTM'. resolution Default 0.5 meters AHN2/AHN3/AHN4, 5 meters AHN1. Choose resolution AHN meters. AHN3 AHN2 0.5 5 meters. AHN1 5 100 m. output.dir Optional unnecessary. Set location output raster files. Leaving blank (default) make output point files temporary files. output directory excludes location AHN sheets depicted sheets.dir parameter. LONLAT Optional. Default FALSE. Set TRUE X Y Longitude Latitude format. Output RD New format. extract.method Default 'simple'. Choose 'simple' (nearest) 'bilinear'. Intersection done using extract() function terra package. See article explains difference two methods. decimals Default 2. Maximum Determines number decimal places output elevation. sheets.method Default FALSE. TRUE, downloads AHN area available GeoTIFF AHN sheets available PDOK. sheets.dir Default 'AHN_sheets' directory working directory output.dir (defined). sheets directory AHN sheets downloaded. sheets already exists directory, reused redownload take place. Within sheets directory, directory structure created automatically: sheets.dir set 'myFolder', sheets downloaded appropriate AHN version DEM folder. Eg. 'output.dir/myFolder/AHN_sheets/AHN4/DSM'. want use parameter want central location AHN sheets stored can accessed elsewhere purposes. recommended always use original file name download. Due size GeoTiff sheets, allowed download RAM memory (tempdir). sheets.keep Default TRUE. applicable sheets.method set TRUE sheets downloaded. Set FALSE want delete downloaded sheet. recommended keep sheets ahn elevation extraction followed.

title: rAHNextract v0.98
text: Released : 11-04-2024.

title: rAHNextract v0.98
text: AHN1-AHN3 currently supported used. Please change ‘AHN’ always use latest version made available PDOK. Currently AHN4. default extraction method receive AHN elevation changed ‘simple’ (nearest) instead bilinear. Please see article explains difference. release downloading point clouds supported. now possible retrieve AHN elevation data exact intersection points 2 AHN sheets.

title: rAHNextract v0.98
text: AHN4 latest full AHN version made available PDOK. release now supports AHN version. ahn_area() introduced ability download AHN sheets using sheets parameter. Introduced function ahn_sheets_info() retrieve information AHN sheets URLs used download. Removed ability use older AHN versions (AHN1-AHN3). planning reintroduce future release. Removed ability download point cloud data AHN. possibly reintroduced future release. Adjusted URLs AHN datasets hosted PDOK can retrieved . code now looks source URLs data frames instead hard coded references code. Efficient checks built see AHN version called currently supported. Reorganised code removed deprecated/unsupported functions. Removed dependencies deprecated ‘rgdal’ package. ‘Terra’ package now used instead ‘raster’. Updated dependent package latest versions. improved R syntax throughout whole code.

title: rAHNextract v0.97
text: Released : 15-05-2020. default values fixes. remove re-download sheet functionality. typos documentation improvements.

title: rAHNextract v0.96
text: Released : 25-04-2020. small missing variables dependency fixes.
